{"id":"JT-49137","entityId":"25-2114502","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"49137"},{"name":"summary","value":"Revise wording for Linked Issues"},{"name":"description","value":"

Wording for controls in links panel:

  • Change the tooltip for the link button in the toolbar to Link issue (we shouldn't use two different verbs for the same action on the UI)
  • Tooltip for expand/collapse control: Show linked issues / **Hide linked issues
  • Tooltip for control to open Issues list: View linked issues in Issues list
  • Control for voting linked issue should have a tooltip: Vote for issue

Dialog:

  • Title [issue ID] [issue link type (drop-down list)]
  • Button text: [Link issue] [Cancel]

@Dmitry Gizatov - any objections?

"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"created","value":"1536737664088"},{"name":"updated","value":"1536741596284"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"mitya"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Dmitry Gizatov"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"Scott.Adams"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Scott Adams"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"5"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"YTB-954","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Issue Links"],"valueId":["Issue Links"],"color":null},{"name":"Component","value":["Frontend"],"valueId":["Frontend"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"sprint 75","id":"YouTrack:sprint 75"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"image1536740627920.png","id":"74-566209","url":"https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/image1536740627920.png?file=74-566209&c=true"},{"value":"image1536740683240.png","id":"74-566210","url":"https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/image1536740683240.png?file=74-566210&c=true"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"27-3062906","author":"mitya","authorFullName":"Dmitry Gizatov","issueId":"JT-49137","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Scott Adams do you suggest change the dialog title, for example, for this issue on "JT-49137 relates to"?

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1536738710809,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-3062920","author":"Scott.Adams","authorFullName":"Scott Adams","issueId":"JT-49137","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Dmitry Gizatov - yes. It just seems logical to use the issue ID as the subject and use the name of the issue link type to form the sentence.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1536739003065,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-3062947","author":"mitya","authorFullName":"Dmitry Gizatov","issueId":"JT-49137","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Scott Adams but in this case the meaning changes, because in this dialog we link the list of issues to current issue as [issue link type (drop-down list)].
For example, in your case "JT-49137 depends on" means that JT-49137 depends on "issue list" but in fact, this "issue list" will depend on JT-49137 on this dialog.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1536739673276,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-3062983","author":"Scott.Adams","authorFullName":"Scott Adams","issueId":"JT-49137","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Dmitry Gizatov - that's not how it works. Directed issue link types have inward and outward names. To produce the result you describe, you have to explicltly select the outward name, which is is required for.


In this example, RDOC-1027 depends on RDOC-882

Here's the result:

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1536740703980,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-3063011","author":"mitya","authorFullName":"Dmitry Gizatov","issueId":"JT-49137","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Scott Adams you right, I've poorly described my idea. The idea is that we link the list of issues to this issue, and not vice versa. And the old title shows it.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1536741596291,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"JT-49112","entityId":"25-2113094","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"49112"},{"name":"summary","value":"Google can't index new FSI"},{"name":"description","value":"

Google tries to render the page but faces a redirect to 'config unavailable'

The shop doesn't collect usage statistics for free licenses.
So it always returns empty data and we show useless empty block...

Another case is for new instances. There is no statistics yet. So no reason to shown empty block as well.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1536583280357,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":"YouTrack Team","markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[{"value":"Star","cssClass":"c0"}]}, {"id":"JT-48790","entityId":"25-2095640","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"48790"},{"name":"summary","value":"Can't add an Issue Distribution Report widget to a dashboard"},{"name":"description","value":"

STR:

  • go to a dashboard on hub.jetbrains.com
  • add the widget
  • select YouTrack
  • select New Report
  • enter a name for the report (I used "TestReport")
  • select Hub as a project
  • click Save

AR:

  • An error "Cannot save report: Property FlatDistributionReport.name is invalid" is shown
  • The json of the POST request doesn't include required data
{"$type":"jetbrains.youtrack.reports.impl.distribution.flat.gap.FlatDistributionReport","name":"","projects":[],"xsortOrder":"COUNT_INDEX_DESC","xaxis":{"field":{"$type":"jetbrains.charisma.keyword.PredefinedFilterField","id":"project","presentation":"project"}},"query":"","own":true}

ER: widget configuration ends successfully
